abstract: In 2008, it took a plunge in the Dow to get Congress to come to agreement on steps to rescue the economy, and it may take the same to resolve the standoff over the budget and the debt ceiling, an economist writes.

lead_paragraph: Jared Bernstein is a senior fellow at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities in Washington and a former chief economist to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

headline.main: Waiting for the Market’s Call to Reason
